meanings.definition: A strip of leather or other material used for welting.
meanings.sent1: The shoemaker used a sturdy welting to reinforce the edges of the leather shoes.
meanings.sent2: The bag's durability was enhanced by the thick welting along the seams.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten batted at the dangling welting on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The welting of friendship between the two neighbors grew stronger with each shared cup of sugar.
meanings.sent5: The welting on the baseball glove made catching fly balls easier for the young player.

meanings.definition: The act of joining two pieces of material with a welt.
meanings.sent1: The skilled tailor's precise welting ensured the seams were securely fastened.
meanings.sent2: The welting on the jacket's pockets added a stylish touch to the garment.
meanings.sent3: As the magician waved his wand, the welting of fabric pieces magically fused together.
meanings.sent4: The welting of the musical notes created a harmonious melody that filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The delicate welting of lace on the dress gave it an elegant and refined look.

meanings.sent1: The cobbler carefully welting the shoes to ensure they would withstand rough terrain.
meanings.sent2: She decided to welt the edges of the blanket for added strength and durability.
meanings.sent3: The chef welting the pastry edges before baking to create a beautiful golden crust.
meanings.sent4: The gardener welting the plant stems to protect them from pests and harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: He welting the seams of the tent to prevent any leaks during the camping trip.
